intro: Kyrsteniopsis chiapasana, commonly known as the Chiapas kyrsteniopsis, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the cloud forests of Chiapas, Mexico. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that form a water-holding structure. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or white in color. Its unique morphology and limited distribution make it an important subject for botanical research and conservation efforts. Due to habitat destruction, Kyrsteniopsis chiapasana faces significant threats to its survival.
